form.official-title: To repeal the provisions of the National Voter Registration Act of 1993 other than the provisions requiring States to conduct a general program that makes a reasonable effort to remove the names of ineligible voters from the official lists of eligible voters in the State and the provisions imposing criminal penalties for fraudulent voter registration or voting activities.

section.header: Repeal of National Voter Registration Act of 1993

subsection.text: Except as provided in subsection (b), the National Voter Registration Act of 1993 (52 U.S.C. 20501 et seq.) is repealed, and any provision of law amended or repealed by such Act is restored or revived as if such Act had not been enacted into law.
Subsection (a) does not apply with respect to the following provisions of such Act:

paragraph.text: Section 1 (relating to the short title) (52 U.S.C. 10101 note).
Any section amended or redesignated under section 2 of this Act.

subsection.header: Revised statement of purposes of Act
subsection.text: Section 2 of the National Voter Registration Act of 1993 (52 U.S.C. 20501) is amended to read as follows:

section.text: The purposes of this Act are to—

paragraph.text: protect the integrity of the electoral process; and
to ensure that accurate and current voter registration rolls are maintained.

subsection.header: Removal of names of ineligible voters from voter registration lists
subsection.text: Section 8 of the National Voter Registration Act of 1993 (52 U.S.C. 20507) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating such section as section 4;
by amending subsection (a) to read as follows:

subsection.header: Removal of names of ineligible voters
subsection.text: In the administration of voter registration for elections for Federal office, each State shall—

paragraph.text: provide that the name of a registrant may not be removed from the official list of eligible voters except—

subparagraph.text: at the request of the registrant;
as provided by State law, by reason of criminal conviction or mental incapacity; or

paragraph.text: conduct a general program that makes a reasonable effort to remove the names of ineligible voters from the official lists of eligible voters by reason of—

subparagraph.text: the death of the registrant; or
a change in the residence of the registrant, in accordance with subsections (b), (c), and (d).

paragraph.text: in subsection (c)(1), by striking subsection (a)(4) and inserting subsection (a)(2); and
in subsection (c)(2)(B)(i), by striking paragraph (3) (A) or (B) or (4)(A) of subsection (a) and inserting paragraph (1)(A) or (B) or (2)(A) of subsection (a).

subsection.header: Designation of chief State election official
subsection.text: Section 10 of such Act (52 U.S.C. 20509) is redesignated as section 5.
Section 12 of such Act (52 U.S.C. 20511) is redesignated as section 6.
